724508f-a.title: Manhattan: Houston Street (West - Sullivan Street
724508f-a.text:
(1)
1229-147 Nest Houston Street, south side, fror Sullivan to Macdougal
Streets, a solid block of six-story tenement houses. Along with
the rest of the south side of Houston Street, from Broadway to
Sixth Avenue, these buildings are shortly to be demolished.
July 17, 1929.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
Window of an Italian bakery at 133-135 West Houston Street, ad-
joining thc S.W. corner of Sullivan Street, a detail of one
of the building included in the above view of 129-147 West
Houston Street.
July 17, 1929.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

723466f-a.title: Manhattan: Sullivan Street - Houston Street
723466f-a.text:
Church of St. Anthony of Padua, 157-153 Sullivan Street, adjoining the
cleared S.E. corner of Houston Street (q.v.). This church edifice
dates from between 1879 and 18B5, but the church was organized in
18o5, and later took over the former Free Congregational Church at
149-151 Sullivan Street adjoining, where the six-story tenement
house is shown in this view. The site of the present church was
occupied by a brewery. St. Anthony of Padua was the first Italian
Roman Catholic congregation to be organized in New York. An un-
successful attenpt to do something for the Italians of New York
had been made in 1859.
June 15, 1930.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
723466f-a.folder: Sullivan Street & Houston Street, Manhattan, NY

724509f-a.title: Manhattan: Houston Street (West) - Sullivan Street.
724509f-a.text:
130-144 West Houston Street, north side, from Sullivan Street towards
MacDougal Street. No. 132, adjoining the corner at the right,
has been recently rebuilt, but the others are substantially the
original block of low houses, set back a little from the sidewalk.
Around 1910 this block was known as Ludlow Place. The original
front stoops have almost all been removed and the basenuents re-
modelled into stores.
February 20, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724509f-a.folder: Houston Street (West) & Sullivan Street., Manhattan, NY
